column3: Context or conditions within which processing takes place
The source or origin of data
column7: Source' is the direct point of data collection; 'origin' would indicate the original/others points of where the data originates from.
column12: Georg P Krog, Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Beatriz Esteves

column3: A source of data that is publicly accessible or available
column7: The term 'Public' is used here in a broad sense. Actual consideration of what is 'Public Data' can vary based on several contextual or jurisdictional factors such as  definition of open, methods of access, permissions and licenses.
column12: Georg P Krog, Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Beatriz Esteves, Paul Ryan, Julian Flake

column3: A source of data that is not publicly accessible or available
column12: Georg P Krog, Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Beatriz Esteves, Paul Ryan, Julian Flake

column3: Processing that involves systematic monitoring of individuals
Processing that involves evaluation and scoring of individuals
Processing that involves matching and combining of personal data
Processing that involves automated decision making
Processing that takes place at large scales
Processing that involves use of innovative and new technologies
Deletion or Erasure of data including any deletion guarantees
column12: Axel Polleres, Rob Brennan, Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Mark Lizar

column3: Duration or temporal limitation on storage of personal data
column12: Axel Polleres, Rob Brennan, Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Mark Lizar

column3: Location or geospatial scope where the data is stored
column12: Axel Polleres, Rob Brennan, Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Mark Lizar

column3: Regularity and temporal span of data restoration/backup mechanisms that guarantee that data is preserved
column12: Axel Polleres, Rob Brennan, Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Mark Lizar

column3: Conditions required or followed regarding storage of data
column12: Axel Polleres, Rob Brennan, Harshvardhan J. Pandit, Mark Lizar
